item.title: Wordy’s new app helps you learn vocabulary while watching movies and TV shows
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Wordy is a new iOS app that offers a unique way to learning English. The app automatically translates and defines unknown words while you watch your favorite movies or TV shows. Wordy has over 500,000 titles available, including popular series such as HBO’s “The Penguin” and the new Disney+ show, “Agatha All Along.” Created by […]

item.title: OpenAI’s $6.5B funding round may close as soon as next week
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The WSJ reports that OpenAI's next funding round, worth around $6.5 billion, could close as soon as the first week in October.

item.title: Bret Taylor of Sierra joins TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
We’re thrilled to welcome Bret Taylor to TechCrunch Disrupt 2024. As the former co-CEO of Salesforce, founder of Quip, former CTO of Facebook, the co-creator of Google Maps, and current chairman of the board at OpenAI, Taylor needs very little introduction.  Bret Taylor is one of the most influential players in the world of enterprise […]

item.title: Amazon dodges antitrust scrutiny in UK over Anthropic investment
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
The U.K.s' antitrust authority has concluded that Amazon's partnership and equity investment in AI startup Anthropic can't be investigated under current merger rules due to the size and scope of the deal.

item.title: Meta fined $101.5M for 2019 breach that exposed hundreds of millions of Facebook passwords
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Reset your clocks: Meta has been hit with yet another privacy penalty in Europe. On Friday, Ireland’s Data Protection Commission (DPC) announced a reprimand and a €91 million fine — around $101.5 million at current exchange rates — after concluding a multiyear investigation into a 2019 security breach by Facebook’s parent company. The DPC opened […]

item.title: UK data watchdog confirms it’s investigating MoneyGram data breach
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The world’s second-largest money transfer provider, which filed a data breach notice with U.K. authorities, serves over 50 million people.

item.title: Napkin is a note-taking app that is not about making you more productive
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Note-taking apps typically aim to make you more efficient and productive. A lot of those apps concentrate on quickly jotting down your thoughts, organizing them better, or a mix of both. Napkin (not to be confused with the Accel-backed startup of the same name) wants to stand out amid these apps by focusing on mindfulness. […]

item.title: Indian game streaming startup Loco sells majority stake to Redwood
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
UAE-based Redwood has acquired a majority stake in the game streaming platform Loco as the Indian firm looks to expand focus to international markets, TechCrunch has learned and confirmed. Redwood, a newly formed investment firm, has signed a $65 million deal with Loco, an investment that also gives full exit to all existing Loco backers. […]

item.title: Starlink hits 4 million subscribers
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
SpaceX’s Starlink satellite internet network is expected to hit a new customer milestone this week, company President Gwynne Shotwell told Texas legislators on Tuesday.  “This week, by the way, we will pass 4 million customers for Starlink, which is quite exciting,” she said while testifying before a state House Appropriations Committee meeting. (The milestone was confirmed […]

item.title: Runway earmarks $5M to fund up to 100 films using AI-generated video
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
AI video generators need to believe that filmmakers will use their models in the production process. Otherwise why exist? To jump-start the new AI film ecosystem, Runway has set aside $5 million in cash and more in service credits to fund up to 100 original films. If you’re an AI-curious director, now’s your chance to […]

item.title: OpenAI’s VP of global affairs claims o1 is ‘virtually perfect’ at correcting bias, but the data doesn’t quite back that up

item.description:
Departures might be dominating the week’s OpenAI-related headlines. But comments on AI bias from Anna Makanju, the company’s VP of global affairs, also grabbed our attention. item.title: Security compliance unicorn Drata lays off 9% of its workforce
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Drata, a security compliance automation platform that helps companies adhere to frameworks such as SOC 2 and GDPR, has laid off 9% of its workforce, amounting to 40 people. Founded in 2020, Drata integrates with dozens of clouds, SaaS apps, developer tools, security systems, and more, helping businesses collate the necessary evidence to prove that their data privacy and security […]

item.title: Nomi’s companion chatbots will now remember things like the colleague you don’t get along with
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
As OpenAI boasts about its o1 model’s increased thoughtfulness, small, self-funded startup Nomi AI is building the same kind of technology. Unlike the broad generalist ChatGPT, which slows down to think through anything from math problems or historical research, Nomi niches down on a specific use case: AI companions. Now, Nomi’s already-sophisticated chatbots take additional […]

item.title: The WordPress vs. WP Engine drama, explained

item.description:
The world of WordPress, one of the most popular technologies for creating and hosting websites, is going through a very heated controversy.
